title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr. Alexander Carlyle, Minister of Inveresk,
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: Lord Elchies left the place and w^ent to Inch, w^here he died soon after. His place w^as in some respects filled by his sou, Mr John Grant, afterwards Baron Grant, who bought Castle Steads. Mr Grant was a worthy good man, of considerable parts, but of a weak, whimsical mind.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr Alexander Carlyle ;
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: The parish of Inveresk this year lost a very agreeable  member ; for the estate of Carberry being sold to a Mr Fullerton, who came to live at it, Lord Elchies left the place and went to Inch, where he died soon after. His place was in some respects filled by his son, Mr John Grant, afterwards Baron Grant, who bought Castle Steads. Mr Grant was a worthy good man, of considerable parts, but of a weak, whimsical mind.
